Issues.Title: Support linear gradient angles as bare values
Issues.Body:
This PR adds support for linear gradient angles as bare values, like this:

```
bg-linear-45 => linear-gradient(45deg, ‚Ä¶)
```

We already support this for [conic gradients](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/pull/14467), so this makes these utilities more consistent.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Support linear gradient angles as bare values" (#14707)

Issues.Title: update fast-glob 3.3.2 which will fix micromatch 4.0.8 dependency (ReDoS) issue
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.4.14

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Vue 3.4.21, Vite 5.1.5

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

Node 20.15.1

**What browser are you using?**

N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

N/A

**Describe your issue**

Once this fast-glob PR gets merged: https://github.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/pull/456

am proposing an update to their next release ( current is 3.3.2 ) and causes the following audit issue 

```
Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) in micromatch (Severity: moderate)
  - Affected package: micromatch
  - Patched in: >=4.0.8
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "update fast-glob 3.3.2 which will fix micromatch 4.0.8 dependency (ReDoS) issue" (#14696)

Issues.Title: Run tests without optimization
Issues.Body:
This PR improves the tests by not running the optimization step (via Lightning CSS) in places where we know that nothing should be generated.

In fact, if _we_ generate invalid CSS where we expected that nothing was being generated, then Lightning CSS will throw the CSS out. This means that we have a bug somewhere in our code, and we should fix it but we don't know about it.

Bonus points: this improves the performance of the tests a tiny bit.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Run tests without optimization" (#14704)

Issues.Title: Make `themeToVar` reusable
Issues.Body:
This PR makes the `themeToVar` code we already use for migrating the `theme(‚Ä¶)` calls to `var(‚Ä¶)` calls in the candidates (found in source files), reusable for the next PR where we want to migrate `theme(‚Ä¶)` calls in your actual CSS.

(This shouldn't really require a separate PR, but I'm playing with Graphite's stacked PR feature to see how it works in practice üòÖ)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Make `themeToVar` reusable" (#14694)

Issues.Title: Add first draft of new wide-gamut color palette
Issues.Body: This PR updates all of the colors in our default theme to use OKLCH instead of RGB and increases the overall chroma to take advantage of the wider color gamut. Just a first draft based on @danhollick's initial work ‚Äî expecting these will be further refined before a stable release as we continue to test them.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add first draft of new wide-gamut color palette" (#14693)

Issues.Title: Don't generate invalid CSS when migrating a complex `screens` config
Issues.Body:
<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Don't generate invalid CSS when migrating a complex `screens` config" (#14691)

Issues.Title: `@apply` is not allowed inside `@keyframes`
Issues.Body:
This PR makes sure that you cannot use `@apply` inside `@keyframes`. 

While some utilities can be used in `@keyframes`, the moment you introduce a variant, that's not going to work anymore because they need to operate on selectors which `@keyframes` don't have.

This PR now removes all usages of `@apply` in `@keyframes`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "`@apply` is not allowed inside `@keyframes`" (#14687)

Issues.Title: Speed up template migrations
Issues.Body:
This PR does two things:
- Computes UTF-16 string positions in Rust rather than in JS ‚Äî eliminating a significant number of traversals of the input string
- Applies replacements to the content in ascending order so we only ever move forward through the source string ‚Äî this lets v8 optimize string concatenation
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Speed up template migrations" (#14679)

Issues.Title: Add user search
Issues.Body:
# Expand Search Functionality to Include Users

This PR enhances the search functionality by including user data alongside tasks. The changes include:

- Renamed `TaskSearch` component to `TaskAndUserSearch`
- Added state management for users in the frontend
- Updated the search input placeholder to reflect the expanded scope
- Modified the backend to return both filtered tasks and users
- Implemented sorting for both tasks and users in alphabetical order
- Added a new section in the UI to display matching users

These updates provide a more comprehensive search experience, allowing users to find both relevant tasks and team members in a single query.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add user search" (#14685)

Issues.Title: Add frontend for search
Issues.Body:
# Add TaskSearch Component for Frontend

This pull request introduces a new `TaskSearch` component for the frontend. The component provides a search functionality for tasks, including:

- A search input field for users to enter their query
- Fetching and displaying search results from the server
- Loading and error state handling

The component uses React hooks (`useState` and `useEffect`) to manage state and side effects. It performs a search request to the server whenever the search query changes, updating the displayed results accordingly.

Key features:
- Real-time search updates as the user types
- Proper error handling for network issues
- Loading indicator during search requests
- Display of task descriptions in a list format

This addition will enhance the user experience by allowing quick and easy searching of tasks within the application.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add frontend for search" (#14684)

Issues.Title: Add server API
Issues.Body:
# Add Express server with task search functionality

This pull request introduces a new Express server with a `/search` endpoint for task management. The server includes:

- A basic Express setup listening on port 3000
- A mock dataset of tasks with IDs and descriptions
- A `/search` endpoint that:
  - Accepts a query parameter for filtering tasks
  - Filters tasks based on the provided query
  - Sorts the filtered tasks alphabetically by description
  - Returns the sorted and filtered tasks as JSON

This addition provides a foundation for a task management API, allowing for easy integration with front-end applications.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add server API" (#14683)

Issues.Title: Remove .gitattributes file
Issues.Body:
I added the `.gitattributes` a while back because I thought it would help us make it simpler when rebasing changes to the `CHANGELOG.md` file. However, I don't think this is actually true. Now, instead of a merge conflict, the rebase just ends up duplicating a lot of lines which we only see when we review the PR on GitHub later which is really annoying.

So, for now, let's remove it again. Ideally we can have a better merge strategy here (or potentially other tools).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove .gitattributes file" (#14676)

Issues.Title: Update @playwright/test 1.47.1 ‚Üí 1.48.0 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è @‚Äãplaywright/test (1.47.1 ‚Üí 1.48.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/Microsoft/playwright)
Release Notes

1.48.0

WebSocket routing

New methods page.routeWebSocket() and browserContext.routeWebSocket() allow to intercept, modify and mock WebSocket connections initiated in the page. Below is a simple example that mocks WebSocket communication by responding to a "request" with a "response".

await page.routeWebSocket('/ws', ws => {
  ws.onMessage(message => {
    if (message === 'request')
      ws.send('response');
  });
});

See WebSocketRoute for more details.

UI updates

  • New "copy" buttons for annotations and test location in the HTML report.
  • Route method calls like route.fulfill() are not shown in the report and trace viewer anymore. You can see which network requests were routed in the network tab instead.
  • New "Copy as cURL" and "Copy as fetch" buttons for requests in the network tab.

Miscellaneous

  • Option form and similar ones now accept FormData.
  • New method page.requestGC() may help detect memory leaks.
  • New option location to pass custom step location.
  • Requests made by APIRequestContext now record detailed timing and security information in the HAR.

Browser Versions

  • Chromium 130.0.6723.19
  • Mozilla Firefox 130.0
  • WebKit 18.0

This version was also tested against the following stable channels:

  • Google Chrome 129
  • Microsoft Edge 129

1.47.2

Highlights

#32699 [REGRESSION]: fix(codegen): use content_frame property in python/.NET
#32706 [REGRESSION]: page.pause() does not pause test timeout after 1.47
#32661 - fix(trace-viewer): time delta between local and remote actions

Browser Versions

  • Chromium 129.0.6668.29
  • Mozilla Firefox 130.0
  • WebKit 18.0

This version was also tested against the following stable channels:

  • Google Chrome 128
  • Microsoft Edge 128

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by more commits than we can show here.

Issues.Title: Release v4.0.0-alpha.27
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Release v4.0.0-alpha.27" (#14671)

Issues.Title: Ensure `font-stretch` utilities only accepts positive integer bare values
Issues.Body:
This PR fixes an issue where bare values in the `font-stretch` utility such as `font-stretch-50.5%` compiled. But for bare values, we want these values to be positive integers only so that we don't have too many special characters.

If you want to use `50.5%`, you can still use `font-stretch-[50.5%]` as a utility.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Ensure `font-stretch` utilities only accepts positive integer bare values" (#14670)
